meanings.sent1: The old-fashioned hat was considered unhip by the young crowd.
meanings.sent2: Her unhip outfit consisted of outdated clothes and mismatched colors.
meanings.sent3: He tried to fit in with the cool kids, but his unhip style gave him away.
meanings.sent4: The unhip music from the 80s blared from the speakers, causing everyone to cringe.
meanings.sent5: The unhip hairstyle made her stand out in a sea of trendy cuts.

meanings.sent1: His unhip behavior at the party embarrassed his friends.
meanings.sent2: She had an unhip understanding of the latest technology trends.
meanings.sent3: The unhip tourist kept asking for directions to the ancient payphone.
meanings.sent4: The unhip student's lack of knowledge about current events was evident.
meanings.sent5: Their unhip comments revealed their ignorance about modern culture.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something seem uncool or out of touch.
meanings.sent1: She tried to unhip her dad's wardrobe by donating his old ties.
meanings.sent2: The marketing campaign unintentionally unhipped the brand among young consumers.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to unhip the party by playing classical music backfired.
meanings.sent4: The new fashion trend threatened to unhip the established clothing stores.
meanings.sent5: The viral video quickly unhipped the once-popular dance move.
